Reviews.Title: “Hotel nuova aurora”
Reviews.Author: Asshhhh
Reviews.Content: Very good option if staying in Venice is too expensive. Clean rooms, cheap price, friendly service. Be warned that there are prostitutes all along the street and if your room is facing the main road, you can watch them from your window. To some, this is too "ghetto". We, however, found it very amusing. Not many prostitutes walking the streets in Australia. What an experience! Hah!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad....”
Reviews.Author: MrRobert1446
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and decided to go by map and walk from train station to it.Wasted an hour because I thought I must have walked past it and back tracked when all in all it was right down the end of the very long road.Room was very good and comfortable for the price and staff very nice.Only thing not even coffee in the morning and the road is very noisy. Would say area safe, but industrial looking and there were hookers DAY and night so not a place if you want a romantic break. You need take bus from across the road as too too far to walk over to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, wonderfull place”
Reviews.Author: rishabhnitc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights towards the end of my 10 days trip. I really loved this place. It is a very good option cause hotels on main island can be bit expensive in main season or if you budget is moderate. although this hotel is not exactly in the main city it is not too far either. the room quality is better than a 2 star hotel. all neat and tidy. The good thing was the hotel staff, especially Dona & Andrean. they provide useful info and more than happy to help. Hotel also provided a shared a kitchen which was a welcome surprise. Kitchen water is potable.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay near Venice”
Reviews.Author: asecea
Reviews.Content: The man from reception knows romanian language. The rooms are clean, but the bathrooms are at common. You can go to Venice very simple, with the local bus for 2.5 euro/pers/trip. You can get the time table of the buses from reception.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: GT_55
Reviews.Content: Nuova Aurora is a small budget motel in Marghera, a few kilometres south of Mestre. The area isn't great - it's essentially a truck-stop on a main road which has a prostitute every 50m. However, should note that on one occasion we walked the entire length of this road late at night without being bothered or feeling threatened. The hotel is no frills, but very decent for the price. The room was clean, the sheets and towels were changed daily and the staff were helpful; even those with poor English skills made efforts to help. Little bit of mildew in the shower, but my own at home is worse. The walls were a little on the thin side and traffic noise / people in the hallway were audible throughout the night, but quiet enough that it didn't bother us. The bus link to Venice is close to the hotel and very convenient, runs until late at night and inexpensive. Overall it was a great base for seeing Venice on a budget; perhaps not as nice as waking up to the sight of the Grand Canal but a pleasant place to sleep over if your pockets don't run that deep!

Reviews.Title: “OK As An Inexpensive Option Close To Venice”
Reviews.Author: TravelerCharlotteNC
Reviews.Content: REVIEWER PERSPECTIVE: * Mid-40â€™s single male traveler from the U.S.A. doing a 4 month world trip. My 21 year old son traveled with me for 30 days in Europe. * Focus is budget accommodations. A good budget hotel/hostel for my standards is: secure, clean, comfortable, quiet at night, with reasonable access to the location I am visiting. Donâ€™t mind staying in (or walking through) a working class neighborhood so long as there isnâ€™t a perceived safety issue. OVERVIEW: This is a decent budget alternative to actually staying in Venice. The room is comfortable, but read the â€œLOCATION AND TRANSPORTATIONâ€� section below before you book. LOCATION AND TRANSPOTATION: * If you donâ€˜t want to pay the costs of a Venetian hotel (this Hotel is located in Mestre), this seems to be about as close to Venice as you can get. * The hotel is on a bus route about 20 to 25 minutes from Venice. Buses run twice per hour and cost about 1.20 euros per trip. (Alternatively, you can by a Venice IMOB Card which includes this bus and the water buses in Venice. The card for an Adult older than 29 costs 33 Euro for 72 hours. If you are 18 to 29 you can buy the â€œVenice Rolling Passâ€�; itâ€˜s the same card but only costs 22 Euro.) * The bus stop is convenient: it is only about 100 meters from the hotel. Make sure you flag the bus as it approaches or it may not stop. * The hotel location was far enough away from Venice that we would not make multiple trips in a day. The reason is simple: while the bus ride is only 20 to 25 minutes, a round trip circuit (from Venice, to the hotel and back) would probably take around 90 minutes after you factor in walking to the hotel and waiting for the bus to arrive at both stops. * The walk from the bus stop isnâ€™t bad (it is very quick), but some people may not like it. During our stay prostitutes were visible both day and night. But keep this in perspective: the area does not feel dangerous (you donâ€˜t see drug dealers, pimps, etc), and no one bothers you as you walk from the Bus Stop to the hotel. *Once you get to the hotel, you are basically stranded here. There is nothing around except a Laundromat downstairs, a small restaurant near the bus stop (not too good), and another restaurant about 200 yards in the opposite direction (this restaurant is actually pretty good and the hotel can tell you how to get there). ROOM QUALITY: The room is good. *It is cleaned every day, the bed is comfortable, and the AC worked well. *There is a closet to hang clothes, a night stand, and a small desk (see picture). The room was plenty large enough for two people. *Noise was not an issue, but you may hear some minor road noise and the occasional shout from a prostitute while awake. The windows are double glazed and do a great job so the noises were heard as â€œbackground noiseâ€� only. Neither were loud enough to wake us up at night, although traffic is noisiest during morning rush hour . Ask for a room away from the street if this is a concern. STAFF: Friendly and helpful. They will look up bus schedules on the internet for you and help in any way possible. Two different Hotel Receptionists allowed me to use the Hotelâ€™s computer to print my flight reservations at no charge. INTERNET: The hotel has a computer in the lobby you can pay to access (1 Euro for 20 minutes). No wireless option. SUMMARY: This is a good hotel to crash in after a day in Venice. For a cheap stay near the town of Venice you will have to decide if this is the best value you can get. For me, the distance from town was the main issue. We viewed the prostitutes as part of the â€œlocal flavorâ€� but didnâ€™t perceive them as a safety issue. If we were to return I would search for hotels IN Venice first, but if the Venice hotels were significantly more expensive I would not hesitate to stay here again.
